message: Hi guys, I have a problem in setting up my ubuntu laptop with an external LG monitor using an HDMI cable. The audio playing through the monitor is high pitched and faster than usual. I know it is a software problem because i have dual boot on my laptop and on Windows the same cable/same monitor works just fine. I read that it is a problem in Ubuntu (I am on 14.04) because of difference in sampling rates, I tried some stuff but didn't work out. Anyone had this problem before?

data.message: No im using Ubuntu 14.04 and i have windows alongside and i do the same as u connecting my laptop with external screen throw HDMI cable with no problems ! that's weired.
Make sure to use the proprietary drivers as it gives better experience  especially wih Nvidia. Speaking according to my experience using it :D

Try clicking on the sound icon in the menu bar above, You'll find a 'sound settings' button. click it and try and check if your settings are correct. sometimes you have to select another output mode from the list
